intro: Beilschmiedia rivularis, commonly known as the stream beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are drupes, which are usually red or orange when mature. Beilschmiedia rivularis is often found growing near streams or in moist, shaded environments, where it thrives in the understory of dense vegetation.
